Package me.marcosassuncao.servsim

Class SimEntity

java.lang.Object
me.marcosassuncao.servsim.SimEntity
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventSink<SimEvent>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractReport, AbstractScheduler, ResourcePool, Server, ServerUser
public abstract class SimEntity extends Object implements EventSink<SimEvent>
This class represents a simulation entity that handles events and that can send events to other entities. When this class is extended, there are a few methods that must be implemented:
  • onStart() is invoked by Simulation when the simulation starts. This is the place where the initial creation of events must be performed. For example, if the entity reads a workload from a file, reading of the workload file and the creation of simulation events will have to be triggered by this method.
  • process(SimEvent) is invoked by Simulation class whenever there is an event that needs to be processed by the entity.
  • onShutdown() is invoked by Simulation before the simulation finishes. If you want to save data in log files this is the method in which the corresponding code would be placed.
Author:
Marcos Dias de Assuncao

    • send

      protected void send(int dest, long delay, Enum type, Object content)
      Used by the entity to send a message (i.e. create an event) to (for) another entity.
      Parameters:
      dest - the id of the target entity
      delay - how many clock units from now this event will be handled
      type - the type of event to be sent
      content - the content associated with the event
